details.description: How to become an approved speed limiter centre - independent speed limiter centres, sponsored speed limiter centres

parts.title: Overview
parts.body:
A speed limiter centre installs or adjusts devices that limit how fast a vehicle can go.

Usually, only existing vehicle dealerships will become a speed limiter centre.

If you want to become a speed limiter centre, you’ll need to get either:

  • approval from VOSA to become an independent centre
  • sponsored by a VOSA approved vehicle or speed limiter maker

parts.title: Independent centres
parts.body:
Complete the application form and send this to VOSA.

Download ‘Application for approval as an independent authorised sealer of road speed limiters’ (PDF, 74KB)

Testing & Support Services (Speed limiter section)

Inspections

VOSA will inspect your premises, facilities and staff before approving your speed limiter centre.

Approval

You’ll receive an authorisation letter from VOSA if your independent speed limiter centre is approved.

parts.title: Sponsored centres
parts.body:
You’ll need to be a sponsored vehicle dealership to become a sponsored speed limiter centre.

Sponsors

Sponsors are VOSA approved makers or suppliers of either:

  • vehicles
  • speed limiters

Once approved, sponsors are able to approve vehicle dealerships they already work with that want to become speed limiter centres.

Get sponsored

Contact the sponsors of your vehicle dealership to ask them if you can become a sponsored speed limiter centre.

You can have more than 1 sponsor.

Inspections

Sponsors carry out regular checks on their approved agents equipment and also provide them with:

  • training
  • technical support
  • new equipment and software

Approval

You’ll receive an authorisation letter from your sponsor if they approve you as a sponsored speed limiter centre.
